interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Dyatlov Pass Incident
Review Date: 2015/01/27
Store: Gemma Atkinson  (Actor, Host),     Matt Stokoe  (Actor, Host),     Renny Harlin  (Director, Host)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ["United Kingdom released, Blu-Ray/Region B : it WILL NOT play on regular DVD player, or on standard US Blu-Ray player. You need multi-region Blu-Ray player to view it in USA/Canada: LANGUAGES: English ( Dolby Digital 2.0 ), English ( Dolby Digital 5.1 ), English ( Dolby Digital Stereo ), English ( DTS-HD Master Audio ), WIDESCREEN (2.35:1), SPECIAL FEATURES: Interactive Menu, Scene Access, SYNOPSIS: In January 1959, ten experienced young skiers set out to travel to a mountain named Mount Otorten in the far north of Russia. The name Otorten translates as 'Don't go there' in the local Mansi language. One of the skiers fell ill and returned. The remaining nine lost their way and ended up on another mountain slope known as Kholat Syakhl (translated as 'Mountain of the Dead' due to the previous deaths that occurred there). On the night of 1 February 1959 something or someone caused the skiers to flee their tent in terror by using knives to slash their way out rather than leaving by the entrance. When they failed to return, search parties were sent out and their bodies were found, some with massive internal injuries but with no external marks on them. The autopsy stated the violent injuries were caused by 'an unknown compelling force'. The area was sealed off for years by the authorities and the deaths and events of that night remain unexplained. Benefitting from original research carried out in Russia, this book attempts to explain what happened to the nine skiers who lost their lives on the 'Mountain of the Dead', in what has come to be known as the 'Dyatlov Pass Incident'. ...The Dyatlov Pass Incident (2013) ( Devil's Pass )"]
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.51 x 6.69 x 0.79 inches; 3.74 Ounces', 'Director': 'Renny Harlin', 'Media Format': 'Import', 'Run time': '96 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 3, 2013', 'Actors': 'Gemma Atkinson, Matt Stokoe, Richard Reid, Holly Goss, Luke Albright', 'Producers': "The Dyatlov Pass Incident (2013) ( Devil's Pass ), The Dyatlov Pass Incident (2013), Devil's Pass", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Studio': 'IMPORTS', 'Country of Origin': 'United Kingdom', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: While I didn't expect much, this was really pretty well done. I watched it with my 15-25 kids and they also enjoyed it. You get a sense of the actual events and the story built around it fictional, but not completely incredible.
Review Title: Worth a watch
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

The Dilemma [Blu-ray]
Vince Vaughn  (Actor, Producer),     Kevin James  (Actor),     Ron Howard  (Director, Producer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
["Vince Vaughn and Kevin James headline an all-star comedy from director Ron Howard. Ronny's (Vaughn) world is turned upside down when he inadvertently sees something he should not have, and makes it his mission to get answers. As the amateur investigation dissolves his world into comic mayhem, he learns that his best friend Nick (James) has a few secrets of his own. Now, Ronny must decide what will happen if he reveals the truth. We are Kevin James (particularly) and Vince Vaughn (generally) fans. We really enjoyed this moving. It was fine for my teenager. It had a story line and some great actors to make it sing. People who like Hitch will definitely like this. King of Queens fans will like Kevin as well.
A great way to spend a few hours
Vampires
James Woods  (Actor),     Daniel Baldwin  (Actor),     John Carpenter  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'The future of mankind rests in the hands of Master Slayer Jack Crow as he moves to prevent the Master Vampire from reaching his ultimate goal for the legions of undead, the ability to walk in daylight.', 'Amazon.com', "Talk about an opening. The first few minutes of John Carpenter's", 'Vampires', '--in which James Woods\'s vampire killer leads a dawn raid on a New Mexico "goon nest" of bloodsuckers--not only suggests a horror movie that will not pull any punches, it even evokes some of the more disturbing dream-memories of American Westerns. Muscular and uncompromised, the sequence suggests a new Carpenter classic unraveling before one\'s eyes. Well, dream on. Things don\'t quite work out that way, but this is still a film to reckon with. There are a few serious (and surprising) misjudgments on the director\'s part, particularly a mishandling of Sheryl Lee\'s role as a prostitute poisoned by the bite of a "master vampire" (who pretty much wiped out Woods\'s team of goon terminators). But aside from some weaknesses, the action is jolting, the suggested complicity of the Catholic Church in destroying monsters is provocative, and the traces of Howard Hawks\'s continuing influence on Carpenter\'s storytelling are in evidence.', '--Tom Keogh']
{'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'James Woods, John Steakley, Mark Boone Junior, Tim Guinee, Don Jakoby, John Carpenter, Maximilian Schell, Thomas Ian Griffith, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Henry Kingi, Sheryl Lee, Thomas Rosales Jr., Daniel Baldwin, David Rowden, Gregory SierraJames Woods, John Steakley, Mark Boone Junior, Tim Guinee, Don Jakoby, John Carpenter, Maximilian Schell, Thomas Ian Griffith, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Henry Kingi, Sheryl Lee, Thomas Rosales Jr., Daniel Baldwin, David Rowden, Gregory Sierra  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 0.7 x 5.4 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43396030640', 'Director': 'John Carpenter', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 9, 1999', 'Actors': 'James Woods, Daniel Baldwin, Sheryl Lee, Thomas Ian Griffith, Maximilian Schell', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Don Jakoby, John Steakley', 'Number of discs': '1'}
"Hey Padre, got a little wood?". Certainly not everyones taste, but the mix of humor and action is good for me.
One of my two favorite movies

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Favorite Genres:** Enjoys comedy, particularly family-friendly content suitable for teenagers, but has shown interest in genre-blending films that incorporate humor with suspense, such as horror-comedy and thriller-inspired narratives.
- **Actor Preferences:** Maintains strong preferences for Kevin James and favors Vince Vaughn, while increasingly open to exploring performances by actors like Gemma Atkinson and Matt Stokoe, reflecting a growing appreciation for actors in more serious or dramatic roles.
- **Director Appreciation:** Interested in films by Ron Howard and John Carpenter, with a newfound curiosity towards the storytelling style of Renny Harlin, indicating a willingness to explore various genres and styles.
- **Viewing Experience:** Values engaging and suspenseful storylines alongside strong character performances and humor. Appreciates films that evoke family discussions and can bridge the gap between entertaining and thought-provoking content.
- **Film Characteristics:** Enjoys films that delve into relatable dilemmas, incorporating comedic elements and some suspenseful themes. Values bonus content like deleted scenes and behind-the-scenes features to enhance the viewing experience.
- **Social Viewing:** Likely enjoys watching movies with family, aligning with a preference for lighthearted films, but is also receptive to more intense themes when balanced with humor or intriguing storytelling.
- **Overall Sentiment:** Generally positive towards films, with high ratings reflecting satisfaction, even when engaging with content that strays from traditional family-friendly norms.
